titleStmt.title: Exceeding good nevves from Ireland being a perfect relation of the relieving of the city of Dublin, by the regiments belonging to Sir Iohn Clotworthy, Col. Hill, and Col. Conway, who fell upon the rebels at Carric-Mac-Rosse in Leimster, putting them all to flight. Also, their taking 200. Horse, 800 gowes [sic], some sheepe, and divers prisoners; besides, a great number of the rebels slaine. Certified by a letter from Ulster, to one of the Britttsh [sic] officers here in England. Published the 30. of May, 1647
titleStmt.author: H. J.

notesStmt.note: Dated and signed on page [8]: Belfast, 10. May, 1647. H.J.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
